frameDefinitions: An Entity aids in the successful completion of a Purpose.
A Benefactor confers a Beneficial_situation to a Beneficiary.
A Possible_event is deemed to have all pre-conditions satisfied; in other words, it has some probability of occurrence, if some (generally implicit) further Condition pertains.
Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.

This frame is concerned with the idea that people (Participant_1, Participant_2, or Participants) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the Competition) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the Prize).
frameExamples: The lenses , like the <t><fex name='Rest'>rest</fex></t> of the exoskeleton, are made of calcite.
A box is an <t>ideal</t> storage device.
His presence at the summit did not <t>BENEFIT</t> diplomatic relations in the slightest.
I <t>befriended</t> the little pony by giving him a piece of apple.
listRoleDefinitions: A <fen>Part</fen> of a larger <fen>Whole</fen> that has been mentioned in prior discourse or is available in the discourse setting.
The previously unmentioned part of the <fen>Whole</fen>.
The larger entitiy or group that is fully made up of the <fen>Part</fen> and the <fen>Rest</fen>.
The item which is useful for some purpose.
The kind of task which is promoted by the use or presence of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
When the <fen>Entity</fen> is useful for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.
The <fen>Benefactor</fen> is the person or thing that gives an advantage to the <fen>Beneficiary</fen>.
The <fen>Beneficiary</fen> is person or thing that receives an advantage from the <fen>Benefactor</fen>.

The <fen>Beneficial_situation</fen> is the item or action that is given to or done for the <fen>Beneficiary</fen> by the <fen>Benefactor</fen>.  A change of possession can, but does not have to occur.
The <fen>Possible_event</fen> has met its preconditions, and will occur if some further <fen>Condition</fen> holds.
The state-of-affairs that does not hold, but if it did, the <fen>Possible_event</fen> would occur.
The time at which the <fen>Possible_event</fen> can occur.
The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2.
The individual whose relationship with <fen>Partner_1</fen> changes.
The individuals whose relationship is changing.
The time when the relationship changes.
Where the relationship is formed.
This role identifies the first (or only) participant in a competition.
This role identifies the second participant in a competition.
This role is used for plural NP participants in a competition.
This role is used for the name of the competition.
The period of time when the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.

Where the event takes place. 
A constituent tagged as <fen>Place</fen> may require annotation on a secondary FE-layer.
listRoleExamples: the GP had stipulated counselling as a complement <fex>to medication</fex>
You should try to persuade the <fex>rest</fex> of the family to do so whatever their personal opinions
<fex>If he wants</fex> , he can have all the fishsticks .
First layer: John's first competition <fex>at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Daily Market Updates & Live Business News
